api_key.description: The Spectro Cloud API key. Can also be set with the `SPECTROCLOUD_APIKEY` environment variable.

host.description: The Spectro Cloud API host url. Can also be set with the `SPECTROCLOUD_HOST` environment variable. Defaults to https://api.spectrocloud.com

ignore_insecure_tls_error.description: Ignore insecure TLS errors for Spectro Cloud API endpoints. Defaults to false.

project_name.description: The Palette project the provider will target. If no value is provided, the `Default` Palette project is used. The default value is `Default`.

retry_attempts.description: Number of retry attempts. Can also be set with the `SPECTROCLOUD_RETRY_ATTEMPTS` environment variable. Defaults to 10.

trace.description: Enable HTTP request tracing. Can also be set with the `SPECTROCLOUD_TRACE` environment variable. To enable Terraform debug logging, set `TF_LOG=DEBUG`. Visit the Terraform documentation to learn more about Terraform [debugging](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/plugin/log/managing).

apply_setting.description: The setting to apply the cluster profile. `DownloadAndInstall` will download and install packs in one action. `DownloadAndInstallLater` will only download artifact and postpone install for later. Default value is `DownloadAndInstall`.

context.description: Specifies cluster context where addon profile is attached. Allowed values are `project` or `tenant`. Defaults to `project`. If  the `project` context is specified, the project name will sourced from the provider configuration parameter [`project_name`](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/spectrocloud/spectrocloud/latest/docs#schema).

id.description: The ID of the cluster profile.

variables.description: A map of cluster profile variables, specified as key-value pairs. For example: `priority = "5"`.

name.description: The name of the pack. The name must be unique within the cluster profile.

registry_uid.description: The registry UID of the pack. The registry UID is the unique identifier of the registry. This attribute is required if there is more than one registry that contains a pack with the same name.

tag.description: The tag of the pack. The tag is the version of the pack. This attribute is required if the pack type is `spectro` or `helm`.

type.description: The type of the pack. Allowed values are `spectro`, `manifest`, `helm`, or `oci`. The default value is spectro. If using an OCI registry for pack, set the type to `oci`.

uid.description: The unique identifier of the pack. The value can be looked up using the [`spectrocloud_pack`](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/spectrocloud/spectrocloud/latest/docs/data-sources/pack) data source. This value is required if the pack type is `spectro` and for `helm` if the chart is from a public helm registry.

values.description: The values of the pack. The values are the configuration values of the pack. The values are specified in YAML format.

content.description: The content of the manifest. The content is the YAML content of the manifest.

name.description: The name of the manifest. The name must be unique within the pack.

block.description: For packs of type `spectro`, `helm`, and `manifest`, at least one pack must be specified.

alert_all_users.description: If set to `true`, the alert will be sent to all users. If `false`, it will target specific users or identifiers.

component.description: The component of the system that the alert is associated with. Currently, `ClusterHealth` is the only supported value.

created_by.description: The user who created the alert.

identifiers.description: A set of unique identifiers to which the alert will be sent. This is used to target specific users or groups.

is_active.description: Indicates whether the alert is active. Set to `true` to activate the alert, or `false` to deactivate it.

project.description: The project to which the alert belongs to.

type.description: The type of alert mechanism to use. Can be either `email` for email alerts or `http` for sending HTTP requests.

body.description: The payload to include in the HTTP request body when the alert is triggered.

headers.description: Optional HTTP headers to include in the request. Each header should be specified as a key-value pair.

method.description: The HTTP method to use for the alert. Supported values are `POST`, `GET`, and `PUT`.

url.description: The target URL to send the HTTP request to when the alert is triggered.

block.description: The configuration block for HTTP-based alerts. This is used when the `type` is set to `http`.
A status block representing the internal status of the alert. This is primarily for internal use and not utilized directly.

pairing_key.description: The pairing key used for appliance pairing.

tags.description: A set of key-value pairs that can be used to organize and categorize the appliance.

uid.description: The unique identifier (UID) for the appliance.

wait.description: If set to `true`, the resource creation will wait for the appliance provisioning process to complete before returning. Defaults to `false`.

block.description: A resource for creating and managing appliances for Edge Native cluster provisioning.

application_profile_uid.description: The unique identifier (UID) of the application profile to use for this application.

name.description: The name of the application being created.

tags.description: A set of tags to associate with the application for easier identification and categorization.

cluster_context.description: The context for the cluster,  Either `tenant` or `project` can be provided.

cluster_group_uid.description: The unique identifier (UID) of the cluster group. Either `cluster_uid` or `cluster_group_uid` can be provided.

cluster_name.description: An optional name for the target cluster.

cluster_uid.description: The unique identifier (UID) of the target cluster. Either `cluster_uid` or `cluster_group_uid` can be provided.

cpu.description: The CPU allocation for the application, specified in integer values.

memory.description: The memory allocation for the application, specified in megabytes.

storage.description: The storage allocation for the application, specified in gigabytes.

block.description: Optional resource limits for the application, including CPU, memory, and storage constraints.
The configuration block for specifying cluster and resource limits for the application.

cloud.description: The cloud provider the profile is eligible for. Default value is `all`.

context.description: Context of the profile. Allowed values are `project`, `cluster`, or `namespace`. Default value is `project`.If  the `project` context is specified, the project name will sourced from the provider configuration parameter [`project_name`](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/spectrocloud/spectrocloud/latest/docs#schema).

name.description: Name of the application profile

tags.description: A list of tags to be applied to the application profile. Tags must be in the form of `key:value`.

version.description: Version of the profile. Default value is 1.0.0.

install_order.description: The installation priority order of the app profile. The order of priority goes from lowest number to highest number. For example, a value of `-3` would be installed before an app profile with a higher number value. No upper and lower limits exist, and you may specify positive and negative integers. The default value is `0`.

name.description: The name of the specified pack.

properties.description: The various properties required by different database tiers eg: `databaseName` and `databaseVolumeSize` size for Redis etc.

registry_uid.description: The unique id of the registry to be used for the pack.

source_app_tier.description: The unique id of the pack to be used as the source for the pack.

tag.description: The identifier or version to label the pack.

type.description: The type of Pack. Allowed values are `container`, `helm`, `manifest`, or `operator-instance`.

uid.description: The unique id of the pack. This is a computed field and is not required to be set.

values.description: The values to be used for the pack. This is a stringified JSON object.

name.description: The name of the manifest.

block.description: The manifest of the pack.
A list of packs to be applied to the application profile.

Provisions an Application Profile. App Profiles are templates created with preconfigured services. You can create as many profiles as required, with multiple tiers serving different functionalities per use case.

bucket_name.description: The name of the storage bucket where backups are stored. This is relevant for S3 or S3-compatible(minio) or gcp storage services.

ca_cert.description: An optional CA certificate used for SSL connections to ensure secure communication with the storage provider. This is relevant for S3 or S3-compatible(minio) storage services.

If  the `project` context is specified, the project name will sourced from the provider configuration parameter [`project_name`](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/spectrocloud/spectrocloud/latest/docs#schema).

is_default.description: Specifies if this backup storage location should be used as the default location for storing backups.

name.description: The name of the backup storage location. This is a unique identifier for the backup location.

region.description: The region where the backup storage is located, typically corresponding to the region of the cloud provider. This is relevant for S3 or S3-compatible(minio) storage services.

storage_provider.description: The storage location provider for backup storage. Allowed values are `aws` or `minio` or `gcp` or `azure`. Default value is `aws`.

azure_tenant_id.description: Unique tenant Id from Azure console.

subscription_id.description: Unique subscription Id from Azure console.

partition.description:

Default is 'aws'.

policy_arns.description: A set of ARNs for the IAM policies that should be associated with the cloud account.

default_project.description: The default project of the OpenStack cloud that is used to connect to the OpenStack cloud.

identity_endpoint.description: The identity endpoint of the OpenStack cloud that is used to connect to the OpenStack cloud.

name.description: Name of the cloud account. This name is used to identify the cloud account in the Spectro Cloud UI.

private_cloud_gateway_id.description: ID of the private cloud gateway. This is the ID of the private cloud gateway that is used to connect to the vSphere cloud.

vsphere_ignore_insecure_error.description: Ignore insecure error. This is a boolean value that indicates whether to ignore the insecure error or not. If not specified, the default value is false.

vsphere_password.description: Password of the vSphere cloud. This is the password of the vSphere cloud that is used to connect to the vSphere cloud.

vsphere_username.description: Username of the vSphere cloud. This is the username of the vSphere cloud that is used to connect to the vSphere cloud.

vsphere_vcenter.description: vCenter server address. This is the address of the vCenter server that is used to connect to the vSphere cloud.

admin_kube_config.description: Admin Kube-config for the cluster. This can be used to connect to the cluster using `kubectl`, With admin privilege.

apply_setting.description: The setting to apply the cluster profile. `DownloadAndInstall` will download and install packs in one action. `DownloadAndInstallLater` will only download artifact and postpone install for later. Default value is `DownloadAndInstall`.

cloud_config_id.description: ID of the cloud config used for the cluster. This cloud config must be of type `azure`.

cluster_meta_attribute.description: `cluster_meta_attribute` can be used to set additional cluster metadata information, eg `{'nic_name': 'test', 'env': 'stage'}`

context.description: The context of the AKS cluster. Allowed values are `project` or `tenant`. Default is `project`. If  the `project` context is specified, the project name will sourced from the provider configuration parameter [`project_name`](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/spectrocloud/spectrocloud/latest/docs#schema).

description.description: The description of the cluster. Default value is empty string.

force_delete.description: If set to `true`, the cluster will be force deleted and user has to manually clean up the provisioned cloud resources.

force_delete_delay.description: Delay duration in minutes to before invoking cluster force delete. Default and minimum is 20.

kubeconfig.description: Kubeconfig for the cluster. This can be used to connect to the cluster using `kubectl`.

os_patch_after.description: The date and time after which to patch the cluster. Prefix the time value with the respective RFC. Ex: `RFC3339: 2006-01-02T15:04:05Z07:00`

os_patch_on_boot.description: Whether to apply OS patch on boot. Default is `false`.

os_patch_schedule.description: The cron schedule for OS patching. This must be in the form of cron syntax. Ex: `0 0 * * *`.

pause_agent_upgrades.description: The pause agent upgrades setting allows to control the automatic upgrade of the Palette component and agent for an individual cluster. The default value is `unlock`, meaning upgrades occur automatically. Setting it to `lock` pauses automatic agent upgrades for the cluster.

review_repave_state.description: To authorize the cluster repave, set the value to `Approved` for approval and `""` to decline. Default value is `""`.

skip_completion.description: If `true`, the cluster will be created asynchronously. Default value is `false`.

tags.description: A list of tags to be applied to the cluster. Tags must be in the form of `key:value`.

backup_location_id.description: The ID of the backup location to use for the backup.

cluster_uids.description: The list of cluster UIDs to include in the backup. If `include_all_clusters` is set to `true`, then all clusters will be included.

expiry_in_hour.description: The number of hours after which the backup will be deleted. For example, if the expiry is set to 24, the backup will be deleted after 24 hours.

include_all_clusters.description: Whether to include all clusters in the backup. If set to false, only the clusters specified in `cluster_uids` will be included.

include_cluster_resources.description: Indicates whether to include cluster resources in the backup. If set to false, only the cluster configuration and disks will be backed up. (Note: Starting with Palette version 4.6, the include_cluster_resources attribute will be deprecated, and a new attribute, include_cluster_resources_mode, will be introduced.)

include_cluster_resources_mode.description: Specifies whether to include the cluster resources in the backup. Supported values are `always`, `never`, and `auto`.

include_disks.description: Whether to include the disks in the backup. If set to false, only the cluster configuration will be backed up.

namespaces.description: The list of Kubernetes namespaces to include in the backup. If not specified, all namespaces will be included.

prefix.description: Prefix for the backup name. The backup name will be of the format <prefix>-<cluster-name>-<timestamp>.

schedule.description: The schedule for the backup. The schedule is specified in cron format. For example, to run the backup every day at 1:00 AM, the schedule should be set to `0 1 * * *`.

block.description: The backup policy for the cluster. If not specified, no backups will be taken.

name.description: The name of the manifest. The name must be unique within the pack.

block.description: For packs of type `spectro`, `helm`, and `manifest`, at least one pack must be specified.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes namespace of the RBAC binding. Required if 'type' is set to 'RoleBinding'.

role.description: The role of the RBAC binding. Required if 'type' is set to 'RoleBinding'.

type.description: The type of the RBAC binding. Can be one of the following values: `RoleBinding`, or `ClusterRoleBinding`.

name.description: The name of the subject. Required if 'type' is set to 'User' or 'Group'.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes namespace of the subject. Required if 'type' is set to 'ServiceAccount'.

type.description: The type of the subject. Can be one of the following values: `User`, `Group`, or `ServiceAccount`.

block.description: The RBAC binding for the cluster.

external_traffic_policy.description: The external traffic policy for the cluster.

host_endpoint_type.description: The type of endpoint for the cluster. Can be either 'Ingress' or 'LoadBalancer'. The default is 'Ingress'.

ingress_host.description: The host for the Ingress endpoint. Required if 'host_endpoint_type' is set to 'Ingress'.

load_balancer_source_ranges.description: The source ranges for the load balancer. Required if 'host_endpoint_type' is set to 'LoadBalancer'.

block.description: The host configuration for the cluster.

additional_security_groups.description: Additional security groups to attach to the instance.

az_subnets.description: Mutually exclusive with `azs`. Use `az_subnets` for Static provisioning.

azs.description: Mutually exclusive with `az_subnets`. Use `azs` for Dynamic provisioning.

capacity_type.description: Capacity type is an instance type,  can be 'on-demand' or 'spot'. Defaults to 'on-demand'.

control_plane.description: Whether this machine pool is a control plane. Defaults to `false`.

control_plane_as_worker.description: Whether this machine pool is a control plane and a worker. Defaults to `false`.

count.description: Number of nodes in the machine pool.

disk_size_gb.description: The disk size in GB for the machine pool nodes.

instance_type.description: The instance type to use for the machine pool nodes.

max.description: Maximum number of nodes in the machine pool. This is used for autoscaling the machine pool.

max_price.description: Maximum price to bid for spot instances. Only applied when instance type is 'spot'.

min.description: Minimum number of nodes in the machine pool. This is used for autoscaling the machine pool.

name.description: The name of the machine pool.

node_repave_interval.description: Minimum number of seconds node should be Ready, before the next node is selected for repave. Default value is `0`, Applicable only for worker pools.

update_strategy.description: Update strategy for the machine pool. Valid values are `RollingUpdateScaleOut` and `RollingUpdateScaleIn`.

action.description: The action to perform on the node. Valid values are: `cordon`, `uncordon`.

node_id.description: The node_id of the node, For example `i-07f899a33dee624f7`

effect.description: The effect of the taint. Allowed values are: `NoSchedule`, `PreferNoSchedule` or `NoExecute`.

images_blacklist.description: List of images to disallow for the namespace. For example, `['nginx:latest', 'redis:latest']`

name.description: Name of the namespace. This is the name of the Kubernetes namespace in the cluster.

resource_allocation.description: Resource allocation for the namespace. This is a map containing the resource type and the resource value. For example, `{cpu_cores: '2', memory_MiB: '2048'}`

block.description: The namespaces for the cluster.
The scan policy for the cluster.
Resource for managing AWS clusters in Spectro Cloud through Palette.

admin_kube_config.description: Admin Kube-config for the cluster. This can be used to connect to the cluster using `kubectl`, With admin privilege.

apply_setting.description: The setting to apply the cluster profile. `DownloadAndInstall` will download and install packs in one action. `DownloadAndInstallLater` will only download artifact and postpone install for later. Default value is `DownloadAndInstall`.

cloud_account_id.description: ID of the cloud account to be used for the cluster. This cloud account must be of type `azure`.

cloud_config_id.description: ID of the cloud config used for the cluster. This cloud config must be of type `azure`.

cluster_meta_attribute.description: `cluster_meta_attribute` can be used to set additional cluster metadata information, eg `{'nic_name': 'test', 'env': 'stage'}`

context.description: The context of the Azure cluster. Allowed values are `project` or `tenant`. Default is `project`. If  the `project` context is specified, the project name will sourced from the provider configuration parameter [`project_name`](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/spectrocloud/spectrocloud/latest/docs#schema).

description.description: The description of the cluster. Default value is empty string.

force_delete.description: If set to `true`, the cluster will be force deleted and user has to manually clean up the provisioned cloud resources.

force_delete_delay.description: Delay duration in minutes to before invoking cluster force delete. Default and minimum is 20.

kubeconfig.description: Kubeconfig for the cluster. This can be used to connect to the cluster using `kubectl`.

name.description: Name of the cluster. This name will be used to create the cluster in Azure.

os_patch_after.description: Date and time after which to patch cluster `RFC3339: 2006-01-02T15:04:05Z07:00`

os_patch_on_boot.description: Whether to apply OS patch on boot. Default is `false`.

os_patch_schedule.description: Cron schedule for OS patching. This must be in the form of `0 0 * * *`.

pause_agent_upgrades.description: The pause agent upgrades setting allows to control the automatic upgrade of the Palette component and agent for an individual cluster. The default value is `unlock`, meaning upgrades occur automatically. Setting it to `lock` pauses automatic agent upgrades for the cluster.

review_repave_state.description: To authorize the cluster repave, set the value to `Approved` for approval and `""` to decline. Default value is `""`.

skip_completion.description: If `true`, the cluster will be created asynchronously. Default value is `false`.

tags.description: A list of tags to be applied to the cluster. Tags must be in the form of `key:value`.

backup_location_id.description: The ID of the backup location to use for the backup.

cluster_uids.description: The list of cluster UIDs to include in the backup. If `include_all_clusters` is set to `true`, then all clusters will be included.

expiry_in_hour.description: The number of hours after which the backup will be deleted. For example, if the expiry is set to 24, the backup will be deleted after 24 hours.

include_all_clusters.description: Whether to include all clusters in the backup. If set to false, only the clusters specified in `cluster_uids` will be included.

include_cluster_resources.description: Indicates whether to include cluster resources in the backup. If set to false, only the cluster configuration and disks will be backed up. (Note: Starting with Palette version 4.6, the include_cluster_resources attribute will be deprecated, and a new attribute, include_cluster_resources_mode, will be introduced.)

include_cluster_resources_mode.description: Specifies whether to include the cluster resources in the backup. Supported values are `always`, `never`, and `auto`.

include_disks.description: Whether to include the disks in the backup. If set to false, only the cluster configuration will be backed up.

namespaces.description: The list of Kubernetes namespaces to include in the backup. If not specified, all namespaces will be included.

prefix.description: Prefix for the backup name. The backup name will be of the format <prefix>-<cluster-name>-<timestamp>.

schedule.description: The schedule for the backup. The schedule is specified in cron format. For example, to run the backup every day at 1:00 AM, the schedule should be set to `0 1 * * *`.

block.description: The backup policy for the cluster. If not specified, no backups will be taken.

resource_allocation.description: Resource allocation for the namespace. This is a map containing the resource type and the resource value. For example, `{cpu_cores: '2', memory_MiB: '2048'}`

block.description: The namespaces for the cluster.
The scan policy for the cluster.
Resource for managing Edge Native clusters in Spectro Cloud through Palette.

admin_kube_config.description: Admin Kube-config for the cluster. This can be used to connect to the cluster using `kubectl`, With admin privilege.

cloud_config_id.description: ID of the cloud config used for the cluster. This cloud config must be of type `azure`.

cluster_meta_attribute.description: `cluster_meta_attribute` can be used to set additional cluster metadata information, eg `{'nic_name': 'test', 'env': 'stage'}`

context.description: The context of the Edge cluster. Allowed values are `project` or `tenant`. Default is `project`. If  the `project` context is specified, the project name will sourced from the provider configuration parameter [`project_name`](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/spectrocloud/spectrocloud/latest/docs#schema).

description.description: The description of the cluster. Default value is empty string.

force_delete.description: If set to `true`, the cluster will be force deleted and user has to manually clean up the provisioned cloud resources.

force_delete_delay.description: Delay duration in minutes to before invoking cluster force delete. Default and minimum is 20.

kubeconfig.description: Kubeconfig for the cluster. This can be used to connect to the cluster using `kubectl`.

os_patch_after.description: Date and time after which to patch cluster `RFC3339: 2006-01-02T15:04:05Z07:00`

os_patch_on_boot.description: Whether to apply OS patch on boot. Default is `false`.

os_patch_schedule.description: Cron schedule for OS patching. This must be in the form of `0 0 * * *`.

pause_agent_upgrades.description: The pause agent upgrades setting allows to control the automatic upgrade of the Palette component and agent for an individual cluster. The default value is `unlock`, meaning upgrades occur automatically. Setting it to `lock` pauses automatic agent upgrades for the cluster.

review_repave_state.description: To authorize the cluster repave, set the value to `Approved` for approval and `""` to decline. Default value is `""`.

skip_completion.description: If `true`, the cluster will be created asynchronously. Default value is `false`.

tags.description: A list of tags to be applied to the cluster. Tags must be in the form of `key:value`.

backup_location_id.description: The ID of the backup location to use for the backup.

cluster_uids.description: The list of cluster UIDs to include in the backup. If `include_all_clusters` is set to `true`, then all clusters will be included.

expiry_in_hour.description: The number of hours after which the backup will be deleted. For example, if the expiry is set to 24, the backup will be deleted after 24 hours.

include_all_clusters.description: Whether to include all clusters in the backup. If set to false, only the clusters specified in `cluster_uids` will be included.

include_cluster_resources.description: Indicates whether to include cluster resources in the backup. If set to false, only the cluster configuration and disks will be backed up. (Note: Starting with Palette version 4.6, the include_cluster_resources attribute will be deprecated, and a new attribute, include_cluster_resources_mode, will be introduced.)

include_cluster_resources_mode.description: Specifies whether to include the cluster resources in the backup. Supported values are `always`, `never`, and `auto`.

include_disks.description: Whether to include the disks in the backup. If set to false, only the cluster configuration will be backed up.

namespaces.description: The list of Kubernetes namespaces to include in the backup. If not specified, all namespaces will be included.

prefix.description: Prefix for the backup name. The backup name will be of the format <prefix>-<cluster-name>-<timestamp>.

schedule.description: The schedule for the backup. The schedule is specified in cron format. For example, to run the backup every day at 1:00 AM, the schedule should be set to `0 1 * * *`.

block.description: The backup policy for the cluster. If not specified, no backups will be taken.

ssh_key.description: Public SSH Key (Secure Shell) to establish, administer, and communicate with remote clusters, `ssh_key & ssh_keys` are mutually exclusive.

ssh_keys.description: List of public SSH (Secure Shell) keys to establish, administer, and communicate with remote clusters, `ssh_key & ssh_keys` are mutually exclusive.

id.description: The ID of the cluster profile.

variables.description: A map of cluster profile variables, specified as key-value pairs. For example: `priority = "5"`.

name.description: The name of the pack. The name must be unique within the cluster profile.

registry_uid.description: The registry UID of the pack. The registry UID is the unique identifier of the registry. This attribute is required if there is more than one registry that contains a pack with the same name.

tag.description: The tag of the pack. The tag is the version of the pack. This attribute is required if the pack type is `spectro` or `helm`.

type.description: The type of the pack. Allowed values are `spectro`, `manifest`, `helm`, or `oci`. The default value is spectro. If using an OCI registry for pack, set the type to `oci`.

uid.description: The unique identifier of the pack. The value can be looked up using the [`spectrocloud_pack`](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/spectrocloud/spectrocloud/latest/docs/data-sources/pack) data source. This value is required if the pack type is `spectro` and for `helm` if the chart is from a public helm registry.

values.description: The values of the pack. The values are the configuration values of the pack. The values are specified in YAML format.

content.description: The content of the manifest. The content is the YAML content of the manifest.

name.description: The name of the manifest. The name must be unique within the pack.

block.description: For packs of type `spectro`, `helm`, and `manifest`, at least one pack must be specified.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes namespace of the RBAC binding. Required if 'type' is set to 'RoleBinding'.

role.description: The role of the RBAC binding. Required if 'type' is set to 'RoleBinding'.

type.description: The type of the RBAC binding. Can be one of the following values: `RoleBinding`, or `ClusterRoleBinding`.

name.description: The name of the subject. Required if 'type' is set to 'User' or 'Group'.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes namespace of the subject. Required if 'type' is set to 'ServiceAccount'.

type.description: The type of the subject. Can be one of the following values: `User`, `Group`, or `ServiceAccount`.

block.description: The RBAC binding for the cluster.

external_traffic_policy.description: The external traffic policy for the cluster.

host_endpoint_type.description: The type of endpoint for the cluster. Can be either 'Ingress' or 'LoadBalancer'. The default is 'Ingress'.

ingress_host.description: The host for the Ingress endpoint. Required if 'host_endpoint_type' is set to 'Ingress'.

load_balancer_source_ranges.description: The source ranges for the load balancer. Required if 'host_endpoint_type' is set to 'LoadBalancer'.

block.description: The host configuration for the cluster.

country_code.description: The country code of the country the cluster is located in.

region_code.description: The region code of where the cluster is located in.

control_plane.description: Whether this machine pool is a control plane. Defaults to `false`.

control_plane_as_worker.description: Whether this machine pool is a control plane and a worker. Defaults to `false`.

count.description: Number of nodes in the machine pool.

node_repave_interval.description: Minimum number of seconds node should be Ready, before the next node is selected for repave. Default value is `0`, Applicable only for worker pools.

update_strategy.description: Update strategy for the machine pool. Valid values are `RollingUpdateScaleOut` and `RollingUpdateScaleIn`.

action.description: The action to perform on the node. Valid values are: `cordon`, `uncordon`.

node_id.description: The node_id of the node, For example `i-07f899a33dee624f7`

effect.description: The effect of the taint. Allowed values are: `NoSchedule`, `PreferNoSchedule` or `NoExecute`.

cloud.description: Specify the infrastructure provider the cluster profile is for. Only Palette supported infrastructure providers can be used. The supported cloud types are - `all, aws, azure, gcp, vsphere, openstack, maas, virtual, baremetal, eks, aks, edge-native, generic, and gke` or any custom cloud provider registered in Palette, e.g., `nutanix`.If the value is set to `all`, then the type must be set to `add-on`. Otherwise, the cluster profile may be incompatible with other providers. Default value is `all`.

Use the value ' cluster ' for a **Full** cluster profile.For an Infrastructure cluster profile, use the value `infra`; for an Add-on cluster profile, use the value `add-on`.System cluster profiles can be specified using the value `system`. To learn more about cluster profiles, refer to the [Cluster Profile](https://docs.spectrocloud.com/cluster-profiles) documentation. Default value is `add-on`.

hidden.description: If `hidden` is set to `true`, then variable will be hidden for overriding the value. By default the `hidden` flag will be set to `false`.

description.description: The description of the cluster. Default value is empty string.

force_delete.description: If set to `true`, the cluster will be force deleted and user has to manually clean up the provisioned cloud resources.

force_delete_delay.description: Delay duration in minutes to before invoking cluster force delete. Default and minimum is 20.

kubeconfig.description: Kubeconfig for the cluster. This can be used to connect to the cluster using `kubectl`.

name.description: The name of the cluster.

os_patch_after.description: The date and time after which to patch the cluster. Prefix the time value with the respective RFC. Ex: `RFC3339: 2006-01-02T15:04:05Z07:00`

os_patch_on_boot.description: Whether to apply OS patch on boot. Default is `false`.

os_patch_schedule.description: The cron schedule for OS patching. This must be in the form of cron syntax. Ex: `0 0 * * *`.

pause_agent_upgrades.description: The pause agent upgrades setting allows to control the automatic upgrade of the Palette component and agent for an individual cluster. The default value is `unlock`, meaning upgrades occur automatically. Setting it to `lock` pauses automatic agent upgrades for the cluster.

review_repave_state.description: To authorize the cluster repave, set the value to `Approved` for approval and `""` to decline. Default value is `""`.

skip_completion.description: If `true`, the cluster will be created asynchronously. Default value is `false`.

tags.description: A list of tags to be applied to the cluster. Tags must be in the form of `key:value`.

backup_location_id.description: The ID of the backup location to use for the backup.

cluster_uids.description: The list of cluster UIDs to include in the backup. If `include_all_clusters` is set to `true`, then all clusters will be included.

expiry_in_hour.description: The number of hours after which the backup will be deleted. For example, if the expiry is set to 24, the backup will be deleted after 24 hours.

include_all_clusters.description: Whether to include all clusters in the backup. If set to false, only the clusters specified in `cluster_uids` will be included.

include_cluster_resources.description: Indicates whether to include cluster resources in the backup. If set to false, only the cluster configuration and disks will be backed up. (Note: Starting with Palette version 4.6, the include_cluster_resources attribute will be deprecated, and a new attribute, include_cluster_resources_mode, will be introduced.)

include_cluster_resources_mode.description: Specifies whether to include the cluster resources in the backup. Supported values are `always`, `never`, and `auto`.

include_disks.description: Whether to include the disks in the backup. If set to false, only the cluster configuration will be backed up.

namespaces.description: The list of Kubernetes namespaces to include in the backup. If not specified, all namespaces will be included.

prefix.description: Prefix for the backup name. The backup name will be of the format <prefix>-<cluster-name>-<timestamp>.

schedule.description: The schedule for the backup. The schedule is specified in cron format. For example, to run the backup every day at 1:00 AM, the schedule should be set to `0 1 * * *`.

block.description: The backup policy for the cluster. If not specified, no backups will be taken.

datacenter.description: The name of the datacenter in vSphere. This is the name of the datacenter as it appears in vSphere.

folder.description: The name of the folder in vSphere. This is the name of the folder as it appears in vSphere.

host_endpoint.description: The host endpoint to use for the cluster. This can be `IP` or `FQDN(External/DDNS)`.

image_template_folder.description: The name of the image template folder in vSphere. This is the name of the folder as it appears in vSphere.

network_search_domain.description: The search domain to use for the cluster in case of DHCP.

network_type.description: The type of network to use for the cluster. This can be `VIP` or `DDNS`.

ntp_servers.description: A list of NTP servers to be used by the cluster.

ssh_key.description: The SSH key to be used for the cluster. This is the public key that will be used to access the cluster nodes. `ssh_key & ssh_keys` are mutually exclusive.

ssh_keys.description: List of public SSH (Secure Shell) keys to establish, administer, and communicate with remote clusters, `ssh_key & ssh_keys` are mutually exclusive.

static_ip.description: Whether to use static IP addresses for the cluster. If `true`, the cluster will use static IP addresses. If `false`, the cluster will use DDNS. Default is `false`.

id.description: The ID of the cluster profile.

variables.description: A map of cluster profile variables, specified as key-value pairs. For example: `priority = "5"`.

name.description: The name of the pack. The name must be unique within the cluster profile.

registry_uid.description: The registry UID of the pack. The registry UID is the unique identifier of the registry. This attribute is required if there is more than one registry that contains a pack with the same name.

tag.description: The tag of the pack. The tag is the version of the pack. This attribute is required if the pack type is `spectro` or `helm`.

type.description: The type of the pack. Allowed values are `spectro`, `manifest`, `helm`, or `oci`. The default value is spectro. If using an OCI registry for pack, set the type to `oci`.

uid.description: The unique identifier of the pack. The value can be looked up using the [`spectrocloud_pack`](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/spectrocloud/spectrocloud/latest/docs/data-sources/pack) data source. This value is required if the pack type is `spectro` and for `helm` if the chart is from a public helm registry.

values.description: The values of the pack. The values are the configuration values of the pack. The values are specified in YAML format.

content.description: The content of the manifest. The content is the YAML content of the manifest.

name.description: The name of the manifest. The name must be unique within the pack.

block.description: For packs of type `spectro`, `helm`, and `manifest`, at least one pack must be specified.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes namespace of the RBAC binding. Required if 'type' is set to 'RoleBinding'.

role.description: The role of the RBAC binding. Required if 'type' is set to 'RoleBinding'.

type.description: The type of the RBAC binding. Can be one of the following values: `RoleBinding`, or `ClusterRoleBinding`.

name.description: The name of the subject. Required if 'type' is set to 'User' or 'Group'.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes namespace of the subject. Required if 'type' is set to 'ServiceAccount'.

type.description: The type of the subject. Can be one of the following values: `User`, `Group`, or `ServiceAccount`.

block.description: The RBAC binding for the cluster.

external_traffic_policy.description: The external traffic policy for the cluster.

host_endpoint_type.description: The type of endpoint for the cluster. Can be either 'Ingress' or 'LoadBalancer'. The default is 'Ingress'.

ingress_host.description: The host for the Ingress endpoint. Required if 'host_endpoint_type' is set to 'Ingress'.

load_balancer_source_ranges.description: The source ranges for the load balancer. Required if 'host_endpoint_type' is set to 'LoadBalancer'.

block.description: The host configuration for the cluster.

country_code.description: The country code of the country the cluster is located in.

region_code.description: The region code of where the cluster is located in.

control_plane.description: Whether this machine pool is a control plane. Defaults to `false`.

control_plane_as_worker.description: Whether this machine pool is a control plane and a worker. Defaults to `false`.

count.description: Number of nodes in the machine pool.

max.description: Maximum number of nodes in the machine pool. This is used for autoscaling the machine pool.

min.description: Minimum number of nodes in the machine pool. This is used for autoscaling the machine pool.

name.description: The name of the machine pool. This is used to identify the machine pool in the cluster.

node_repave_interval.description: Minimum number of seconds node should be Ready, before the next node is selected for repave. Default value is `0`, Applicable only for worker pools.

update_strategy.description: Update strategy for the machine pool. Valid values are `RollingUpdateScaleOut` and `RollingUpdateScaleIn`.

disk_size_gb.description: The size of the disk in GB.

memory_mb.description: The amount of memory in MB.

action.description: The action to perform on the node. Valid values are: `cordon`, `uncordon`.

node_id.description: The node_id of the node, For example `i-07f899a33dee624f7`

cluster.description: The name of the cluster to use for the machine pool. As it appears in the vSphere.

datastore.description: The name of the datastore to use for the machine pool. As it appears in the vSphere.

network.description: The name of the network to use for the machine pool. As it appears in the vSphere.

resource_pool.description: The name of the resource pool to use for the machine pool. As it appears in the vSphere.

static_ip_pool_id.description: The ID of the static IP pool to use for the machine pool in case of static cluster placement.

effect.description: The effect of the taint. Allowed values are: `NoSchedule`, `PreferNoSchedule` or `NoExecute`.

images_blacklist.description: List of images to disallow for the namespace. For example, `['nginx:latest', 'redis:latest']`

name.description: Name of the namespace. This is the name of the Kubernetes namespace in the cluster.

resource_allocation.description: Resource allocation for the namespace. This is a map containing the resource type and the resource value. For example, `{cpu_cores: '2', memory_MiB: '2048'}`

block.description: The namespaces for the cluster.
The scan policy for the cluster.

cluster_uid.description: The cluster UID to which the virtual machine belongs to.

vm_name.description: The name of the virtual machine to which the data volume belongs to.

vm_namespace.description: The namespace of the virtual machine to which the data volume belongs to.

block.description: DataVolumeSpec defines our specification for a DataVolume type

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map stored with the DataVolume that may be used to store arbitrary metadata. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

generation.description: A sequence number representing a specific generation of the desired state.

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the DataVolume. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels

name.description: Name of the DataVolume, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

namespace.description: Namespace defines the space within which name of the DataVolume must be unique.

resource_version.description: An opaque value that represents the internal version of this DataVolume that can be used by clients to determine when DataVolume has changed. Read more: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency

uid.description: The unique in time and space value for this DataVolume. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#uids

block.description: Standard DataVolume's metadata. More info: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

access_modes.description: A set of the desired access modes the volume should have. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/persistent-volumes#access-modes-1

storage_class_name.description: Name of the storage class requested by the claim

volume_mode.description: volumeMode defines what type of volume is required by the claim. Value of Filesystem is implied when not included in claim spec.

volume_name.description: The binding reference to the PersistentVolume backing this claim.

limits.description: Map describing the maximum amount of compute resources allowed. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/compute-resources/

requests.description: Map describing the minimum amount of compute resources required. If this is omitted for a container, it defaults to `limits` if that is explicitly specified, otherwise to an implementation-defined value. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/compute-resources/

block.description: A list of the minimum resources the volume should have. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/persistent-volumes#resources

match_labels.description: A map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of `match_expressions`, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: A key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators ard `In`, `NotIn`, `Exists` and `DoesNotExist`.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

block.description: A list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

cpu.description: Defines the number of CPU cores allocated to the cluster.

hide_system_cluster_group.description: If set to `true`, hides the system cluster.

memory.description: Specifies the amount of memory (in GiB) allocated to the cluster.

storage.description: Defines the storage capacity (in GiB) allocated to the cluster.

virtual_clusters_limit.description: Specifies the number of virtual clusters to be created.

name.description: The name of the filter.

block.description: Metadata of the filter.

conjunction.description: Conjunction operation of the filter group. Valid values are 'and' and 'or'.

negation.description: Negation flag of the filter condition.

operator.description: Operator of the filter. Valid values are 'eq'.

values.description: Values of the filter.

name.description: The name of the macro or service variable output.

value.description: The value that the macro or service output variable will contain.

block.description: A resource for creating and managing service output variables and macro.

macros.description: The key-value mapping includes the macro name and its corresponding value, representing either a macro or a service variable output.

block.description: A resource for creating and managing service output variables and macros.

first_reminder_days.description: The number of days before the password expiry to send the first reminder to the user. Default is `5` days before expiry.

min_digits.description: The minimum number of numeric digits (0-9) required in the password. Ensures that passwords contain numerical characters. Minimum length of digit should be `1`.

min_lowercase_letters.description: The minimum number of lowercase letters (a-z) required in the password. Ensures that lowercase characters are included for password complexity. Minimum length of lower case should be `1`.

min_password_length.description: The minimum length required for the password. Enforces a stronger password policy by ensuring a minimum number of characters.  Default minimum length is `6`.

min_special_characters.description: The minimum number of special characters (e.g., !, @, #, $, %) required in the password. This increases the password's security level by including symbols. Minimum special characters should be `1`.

min_uppercase_letters.description: The minimum number of uppercase letters (A-Z) required in the password. Helps ensure password complexity with a mix of case-sensitive characters. Minimum length of upper case should be `1`.

password_expiry_days.description: The number of days before the password expires. Must be between 1 and 1000 days. Defines how often passwords must be changed.  Default is `999` days for expiry.

password_regex.description: A regular expression (regex) to define custom password patterns, such as enforcing specific characters or sequences in the password.

cluster_auto_remediation.description: Enables automatic remediation for unhealthy nodes in Palette-provisioned clusters by replacing them with new nodes. Disabling this feature prevents auto-remediation. Not applicable to `EKS`, `AKS`, or `TKE` clusters.

context.description: Defines the scope of the platform setting. Valid values are `project` or `tenant`. By default, it is set to `tenant`. If  the `project` context is specified, the project name will sourced from the provider configuration parameter [`project_name`](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/spectrocloud/spectrocloud/latest/docs#schema).

enable_auto_remediation.description: Enables automatic remediation. set only with `project' context

non_fips_addon_pack.description: Allows users in this tenant to use non-FIPS-compliant addon packs when creating cluster profiles. The `non_fips_addon_pack` only supported in palette vertex environment.

non_fips_cluster_import.description: Allows users in this tenant to import clusters, but the imported clusters may not be FIPS-compliant.  The `non_fips_cluster_import` only supported in palette vertex environment.

non_fips_features.description: Allows users in this tenant to access non-FIPS-compliant features such as backup, restore, and scans. The `non_fips_features` only supported in palette vertex environment.

pause_agent_upgrades.description: Controls automatic upgrades for Palette components and agents in clusters deployed under a tenant or project. Setting it to `lock` disables automatic upgrades, while `unlock` (default) allows automatic upgrades.

session_timeout.description: Specifies the duration (in minutes) of inactivity before a user is automatically logged out. The default is 240 minutes allowed in Palette

message.description: Specify the message displayed in the login banner.

title.description: Specify the title of the login banner.

block.description: Configure a login banner that users must acknowledge before signing in.

data_center.description: The data center in which the private cloud resides.

network.description: The network to which the private cloud gateway is mapped.

private_cloud_gateway_id.description: The ID of the Private Cloud Gateway.

search_domain_name.description: The domain name used for DNS search queries within the private cloud.

block.description: This resource allows for the management of DNS mappings for private cloud gateways. This helps ensure proper DNS resolution for resources within the private cloud environment.

gateway.description: The network gateway IP address for the IP pool. Typically, this is the default network gateway for the subnet.

ip_end_range.description: The end IP address of the IP pool. Required if `network_type` is `range`.

ip_start_range.description: The start IP address of the IP pool. Required if `network_type` is `range`.

name.description: The name of the IP pool.

nameserver_addresses.description: The list of nameserver IP addresses for the IP pool.

nameserver_search_suffix.description: The list of nameserver search suffixes for the IP pool. For example, `example.org`.

network_type.description: The type of network for the IP pool. Allowed values are: `range` and `subnet`.

prefix.description: The prefix of the IP pool provided network range or subnet. For example `24` for a `/24` subnet or a range that falls inside a `24` subnet.

private_cloud_gateway_id.description: The ID of the Private Cloud Gateway.

restrict_to_single_cluster.description: Restrict the IP pool to a single cluster. If set to `true`, the IP pool is restricted to a single cluster. We recommend setting this to `true` for production environments and creating separate IP pools for each cluster.

subnet_cidr.description: The subnet CIDR of the IP pool. Required if `network_type` is `subnet`.

tags.description: Assign tags to the project.

name.description: The name of the registration token.

project_uid.description: The unique identifier of the project associated with the registration token.

status.description: The status of the registration token. Allowed values are `active` or `inactive`. Default is `active`.

name.description: The name of the Helm registry. This must be unique

credential_type.description: The type of authentication used for the Helm registry. Supported values are 'noAuth' for no authentication, 'basic' for username/password, and 'token' for token-based authentication.

token.description: The authentication token. Required if 'credential_type' is set to 'token'.

username.description: The username for basic authentication. Required if 'credential_type' is set to 'basic'.

base_content_path.description: The relative path to the endpoint specified.

endpoint.description: The URL endpoint of the OCI registry. This is where the container images are hosted and accessed.

endpoint_suffix.description: Specifies a suffix to append to the endpoint. This field is optional, but some registries (e.g., JFrog) may require it. The final registry URL is constructed by appending this suffix to the endpoint.

is_private.description: Specifies whether the registry is private or public. Private registries require authentication to access.

is_synchronization.description: Specifies whether the registry is synchronized.

name.description: The name of the OCI registry.

provider_type.description: The type of provider used for interacting with the registry. Supported value's are `helm`, `zarf` and `pack`, The default is 'helm'. `zarf` is allowed with `type="basic"`

type.description: The type of the registry. Possible values are 'ecr' (Amazon Elastic Container Registry) or 'basic' (for other types of OCI registries).

access_key.description: The access key for accessing the registry. Required if 'credential_type' is set to 'secret'.

arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used for AWS-based authentication. Required if 'credential_type' is 'sts'.

credential_type.description: The type of authentication used for accessing the registry. Supported values are 'secret', 'sts', 'basic', and 'noAuth'.

external_id.description: The external ID used for AWS STS (Security Token Service) authentication. Required if 'credential_type' is 'sts'.

password.description: The password for basic authentication. Required if 'credential_type' is 'basic'.

secret_key.description: The secret key for accessing the registry. Required if 'credential_type' is set to 'secret'.

username.description: The username for basic authentication. Required if 'credential_type' is 'basic'.

certificate.description: Specifies the TLS certificate used for secure communication. Required for enabling SSL/TLS encryption.

insecure_skip_verify.description: Disables TLS certificate verification when set to true. Use with caution as it may expose connections to security risks.

admin_kube_config.description: Admin Kube-config for the cluster. This can be used to connect to the cluster using `kubectl`, With admin privilege.

apply_setting.description: The setting to apply the cluster profile. `DownloadAndInstall` will download and install packs in one action. `DownloadAndInstallLater` will only download artifact and postpone install for later. Default value is `DownloadAndInstall`.

cloud_config_id.description: ID of the cloud config used for the cluster. This cloud config must be of type `azure`.

context.description: The context of the virtual cluster. Allowed values are `project` or `tenant`. Default is `project`. If  the `project` context is specified, the project name will sourced from the provider configuration parameter [`project_name`](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/spectrocloud/spectrocloud/latest/docs#schema).

description.description: The description of the cluster. Default value is empty string.

force_delete.description: If set to `true`, the cluster will be force deleted and user has to manually clean up the provisioned cloud resources.

force_delete_delay.description: Delay duration in minutes to before invoking cluster force delete. Default and minimum is 20.

kubeconfig.description: Kubeconfig for the cluster. This can be used to connect to the cluster using `kubectl`.

os_patch_after.description: The date and time after which to patch the cluster. Prefix the time value with the respective RFC. Ex: `RFC3339: 2006-01-02T15:04:05Z07:00`

os_patch_on_boot.description: Whether to apply OS patch on boot. Default is `false`.

os_patch_schedule.description: Cron schedule for OS patching. This must be in the form of `0 0 * * *`.

pause_cluster.description: To pause and resume cluster state. Set to true to pause running cluster & false to resume it.

skip_completion.description: If `true`, the cluster will be created asynchronously. Default value is `false`.

tags.description: A list of tags to be applied to the cluster. Tags must be in the form of `key:value`.

backup_location_id.description: The ID of the backup location to use for the backup.

cluster_uids.description: The list of cluster UIDs to include in the backup. If `include_all_clusters` is set to `true`, then all clusters will be included.

expiry_in_hour.description: The number of hours after which the backup will be deleted. For example, if the expiry is set to 24, the backup will be deleted after 24 hours.

include_all_clusters.description: Whether to include all clusters in the backup. If set to false, only the clusters specified in `cluster_uids` will be included.

include_cluster_resources.description: Indicates whether to include cluster resources in the backup. If set to false, only the cluster configuration and disks will be backed up. (Note: Starting with Palette version 4.6, the include_cluster_resources attribute will be deprecated, and a new attribute, include_cluster_resources_mode, will be introduced.)

include_cluster_resources_mode.description: Specifies whether to include the cluster resources in the backup. Supported values are `always`, `never`, and `auto`.

include_disks.description: Whether to include the disks in the backup. If set to false, only the cluster configuration will be backed up.

namespaces.description: The list of Kubernetes namespaces to include in the backup. If not specified, all namespaces will be included.

prefix.description: Prefix for the backup name. The backup name will be of the format <prefix>-<cluster-name>-<timestamp>.

schedule.description: The schedule for the backup. The schedule is specified in cron format. For example, to run the backup every day at 1:00 AM, the schedule should be set to `0 1 * * *`.

block.description: The backup policy for the cluster. If not specified, no backups will be taken.

id.description: The ID of the cluster profile.

variables.description: A map of cluster profile variables, specified as key-value pairs. For example: `priority = "5"`.

name.description: The name of the pack. The name must be unique within the cluster profile.

registry_uid.description: The registry UID of the pack. The registry UID is the unique identifier of the registry. This attribute is required if there is more than one registry that contains a pack with the same name.

tag.description: The tag of the pack. The tag is the version of the pack. This attribute is required if the pack type is `spectro` or `helm`.

type.description: The type of the pack. Allowed values are `spectro`, `manifest`, `helm`, or `oci`. The default value is spectro. If using an OCI registry for pack, set the type to `oci`.

uid.description: The unique identifier of the pack. The value can be looked up using the [`spectrocloud_pack`](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/spectrocloud/spectrocloud/latest/docs/data-sources/pack) data source. This value is required if the pack type is `spectro` and for `helm` if the chart is from a public helm registry.

values.description: The values of the pack. The values are the configuration values of the pack. The values are specified in YAML format.

content.description: The content of the manifest. The content is the YAML content of the manifest.

name.description: The name of the manifest. The name must be unique within the pack.

block.description: For packs of type `spectro`, `helm`, and `manifest`, at least one pack must be specified.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes namespace of the RBAC binding. Required if 'type' is set to 'RoleBinding'.

role.description: The role of the RBAC binding. Required if 'type' is set to 'RoleBinding'.

type.description: The type of the RBAC binding. Can be one of the following values: `RoleBinding`, or `ClusterRoleBinding`.

name.description: The name of the subject. Required if 'type' is set to 'User' or 'Group'.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes namespace of the subject. Required if 'type' is set to 'ServiceAccount'.

type.description: The type of the subject. Can be one of the following values: `User`, `Group`, or `ServiceAccount`.

block.description: The RBAC binding for the cluster.

images_blacklist.description: List of images to disallow for the namespace. For example, `['nginx:latest', 'redis:latest']`

name.description: Name of the namespace. This is the name of the Kubernetes namespace in the cluster.

resource_allocation.description: Resource allocation for the namespace. This is a map containing the resource type and the resource value. For example, `{cpu_cores: '2', memory_MiB: '2048'}`

block.description: The namespaces for the cluster.
The scan policy for the cluster.
A resource to manage a Palette Virtual Cluster.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map stored with the VM that may be used to store arbitrary metadata.

base_vm_name.description: The name of the source virtual machine that a clone will be created of.

cluster_context.description: Context of the cluster. Allowed values are `project`, `tenant`. Default value is `project`.

cluster_uid.description: The cluster UID to which the virtual machine belongs to.

dns_policy.description: DNSPolicy defines how a pod's DNS will be configured.

eviction_strategy.description: EvictionStrategy can be set to "LiveMigrate" if the VirtualMachineInstance should be migrated instead of shut-off in case of a node drain.

generate_name.description: Prefix, used by the server, to generate a unique name ONLY IF the `name` field has not been provided. This value will also be combined with a unique suffix. Read more: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#idempotency

generation.description: A sequence number representing a specific generation of the desired state.

hostname.description: Specifies the hostname of the vmi.

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select). May match selectors of replication controllers and services.

name.description: Name of the virtual machine, must be unique. Cannot be updated.

namespace.description: Namespace defines the space within, Name must be unique.

node_selector.description: NodeSelector is a selector which must be true for the vmi to fit on a node. Selector which must match a node's labels for the vmi to be scheduled on that node.

priority_class_name.description: If specified, indicates the pod's priority. If not specified, the pod priority will be default or zero if there is no default.

resource_version.description: An opaque value that represents the internal version of this VM that can be used by clients to determine when VM has changed.

run_on_launch.description: If set to `true`, the virtual machine will be started when the cluster is launched. Default value is `true`.

run_strategy.description: Running state indicates the requested running state of the VirtualMachineInstance, mutually exclusive with Running.

scheduler_name.description: If specified, the VMI will be dispatched by specified scheduler. If not specified, the VMI will be dispatched by default scheduler.

subdomain.description: If specified, the fully qualified vmi hostname will be "<hostname>.<subdomain>.<pod namespace>.svc.<cluster domain>".

termination_grace_period_seconds.description: Grace period observed after signalling a VirtualMachineInstance to stop after which the VirtualMachineInstance is force terminated.

uid.description: The unique in time and space value for this VM.

vm_action.description: The action to be performed on the virtual machine. Valid values are: `start`, `stop`, `restart`, `pause`, `resume`, `migrate`. Default value is `start`.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: Operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists, DoesNotExist. Gt, and Lt.

values.description: Values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty. If the operator is Gt or Lt, the values array must have a single element, which will be interpreted as an integer. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

block.description: List of node selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.
A node selector term, associated with the corresponding weight.

The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, RequiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding 'weight' to the sum if the node matches the corresponding MatchExpressions; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: Operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists, DoesNotExist. Gt, and Lt.

values.description: Values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty. If the operator is Gt or Lt, the values array must have a single element, which will be interpreted as an integer. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

block.description: List of node selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.
List of node selector terms. The terms are ORed.

If the affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the pod will not be scheduled onto the node. If the affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to a node label update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node.
Node affinity scheduling rules for the pod.

weight.description: weight associated with matching the corresponding podAffinityTerm, in the range 1-100

namespaces.description: namespaces specifies which namespaces the labelSelector applies to (matches against); null or empty list means 'this pod's namespace'

topology_key.description: empty topology key is interpreted by the scheduler as 'all topologies'

match_labels.description: A map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of `match_expressions`, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: A key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators ard `In`, `NotIn`, `Exists` and `DoesNotExist`.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the anti-affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, RequiredDuringScheduling anti-affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding 'weight' to the sum if the node matches the corresponding MatchExpressions; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred.

If the affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the pod will not be scheduled onto the node. If the affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to a pod label update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node. When there are multiple elements, the lists of nodes corresponding to each PodAffinityTerm are intersected, i.e. all terms must be satisfied.

cores.description: Cores is the number of cores inside the vmi. Must be a value greater or equal 1

serial.description: Serial provides the ability to specify a serial number for the disk device.

bus.description: Bus indicates the type of disk device to emulate.

pci_address.description: If specified, the virtual disk will be placed on the guests pci address with the specifed PCI address. For example: 0000:81:01.10

DiskDevice specifies as which device the disk should be added to the guest.

interface_binding_method.description: Represents the Interface model, One of: e1000, e1000e, ne2k_pci, pcnet, rtl8139, virtio. Defaults to virtio.

model.description: Represents the method which will be used to connect the interface to the guest.

name.description: Logical name of the interface as well as a reference to the associated networks.

block.description: Interfaces describe network interfaces which are added to the vmi.
Specification of the desired behavior of the VirtualMachineInstance on the host.

guest.description: Guest is the amount of memory allocated to the vmi. This value must be less than or equal to the limit if specified.

hugepages.description: Hugepages attribute specifies the hugepage size, for x86_64 architecture valid values are 1Gi and 2Mi.

block.description: Memory allows specifying the vmi memory features.

name.description: Network name.

default.description: Select the default network and add it to the multus-cni.io/default-network annotation.

network_name.description: References to a NetworkAttachmentDefinition CRD object. Format: <networkName>, <namespace>/<networkName>. If namespace is not specified, VMI namespace is assumed.

block.description: Multus network.
Pod network.

List of networks that can be attached to a vm's virtual interface.

nameservers.description: A list of DNS name server IP addresses. This will be appended to the base nameservers generated from DNSPolicy. Duplicated nameservers will be removed.

searches.description: A list of DNS search domains for host-name lookup. This will be appended to the base search paths generated from DNSPolicy. Duplicated search paths will be removed.

name.description: Name of the option.

value.description: Value of the option. Optional: Defaults to empty.

block.description: A list of DNS resolver options. This will be merged with the base options generated from DNSPolicy. Duplicated entries will be removed. Resolution options given in Options will override those that appear in the base DNSPolicy.
Specifies the DNS parameters of a pod. Parameters specified here will be merged to the generated DNS configuration based on DNSPolicy. Optional: Defaults to empty

limits.description: Requests is the maximum amount of compute resources allowed. Valid resource keys are "memory" and "cpu"

over_commit_guest_overhead.description: Don't ask the scheduler to take the guest-management overhead into account. Instead put the overhead only into the container's memory limit. This can lead to crashes if all memory is in use on a node. Defaults to false.

requests.description: Requests is a description of the initial vmi resources.

block.description: Resources describes the Compute Resources required by this vmi.

created.description: Created indicates if the virtual machine is created in the cluster.

ready.description: Ready indicates if the virtual machine is running and ready.

status.description: ConditionStatus represents the status of this VM condition, if the VM currently in the condition.

type.description: VirtualMachineConditionType represent the type of the VM as concluded from its VMi status.

action.description: Indicates the type of action that is requested. e.g. Start or Stop.

data.description: Provides additional data in order to perform the Action.

block.description: StateChangeRequests indicates a list of actions that should be taken on a VMI.
VirtualMachineStatus represents the status returned by the controller to describe how the VirtualMachine is doing.

effect.description: Effect indicates the taint effect to match. Empty means match all taint effects. When specified, allowed values are NoSchedule, PreferNoSchedule and NoExecute.

key.description: Key is the taint key that the toleration applies to. Empty means match all taint keys. If the key is empty, operator must be Exists; this combination means to match all values and all keys.

operator.description: Operator represents a key's relationship to the value. Valid operators are Exists and Equal. Defaults to Equal. Exists is equivalent to wildcard for value, so that a pod can tolerate all taints of a particular category.

toleration_seconds.description: TolerationSeconds represents the period of time the toleration (which must be of effect NoExecute, otherwise this field is ignored) tolerates the taint. By default, it is not set, which means tolerate the taint forever (do not evict). Zero and negative values will be treated as 0 (evict immediately) by the system.

value.description: Value is the taint value the toleration matches to. If the operator is Exists, the value should be empty, otherwise just a regular string.

block.description: If specified, the pod's toleration. Optional: Defaults to empty

This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

block.description: If unspecified, each key-value pair in the Data field of the referenced ConfigMap will be projected into the volume as a file whose name is the key and content is the value. backup_location_id.description: The ID of the backup location to use for the backup.

cluster_uids.description: The list of cluster UIDs to include in the backup. If `include_all_clusters` is set to `true`, then all clusters will be included.

expiry_in_hour.description: The number of hours after which the backup will be deleted. For example, if the expiry is set to 24, the backup will be deleted after 24 hours.

include_all_clusters.description: Whether to include all clusters in the backup. If set to false, only the clusters specified in `cluster_uids` will be included.

include_cluster_resources.description: Indicates whether to include cluster resources in the backup. If set to false, only the cluster configuration and disks will be backed up. (Note: Starting with Palette version 4.6, the include_cluster_resources attribute will be deprecated, and a new attribute, include_cluster_resources_mode, will be introduced.)

include_cluster_resources_mode.description: Specifies whether to include the cluster resources in the backup. Supported values are `always`, `never`, and `auto`.

include_disks.description: Whether to include the disks in the backup. If set to false, only the cluster configuration will be backed up.

namespaces.description: The list of Kubernetes namespaces to include in the backup. If not specified, all namespaces will be included.

prefix.description: Prefix for the backup name. The backup name will be of the format <prefix>-<cluster-name>-<timestamp>.

schedule.description: The schedule for the backup. The schedule is specified in cron format. For example, to run the backup every day at 1:00 AM, the schedule should be set to `0 1 * * *`.

block.description: The backup policy for the cluster. If not specified, no backups will be taken.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes namespace of the RBAC binding. Required if 'type' is set to 'RoleBinding'.

role.description: The role of the RBAC binding. Required if 'type' is set to 'RoleBinding'.

type.description: The type of the RBAC binding. Can be one of the following values: `RoleBinding`, or `ClusterRoleBinding`.

name.description: The name of the subject. Required if 'type' is set to 'User' or 'Group'.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes namespace of the subject. Required if 'type' is set to 'ServiceAccount'.

type.description: The type of the subject. Can be one of the following values: `User`, `Group`, or `ServiceAccount`.

block.description: The RBAC binding for the cluster.

images_blacklist.description: List of images to disallow for the namespace. For example, `['nginx:latest', 'redis:latest']`

name.description: Name of the namespace. This is the name of the Kubernetes namespace in the cluster.

resource_allocation.description: Resource allocation for the namespace. This is a map containing the resource type and the resource value. For example, `{cpu_cores: '2', memory_MiB: '2048'}`

block.description: The namespaces for the cluster.

architecture.description: The architecture of the appliance. Supported values are: 'amd64', and  'arm64'.

health.description: The health of the appliance. Supported values are: 'healthy', and 'unhealthy'.

id.description: ID of the appliance registered in Palette.

name.description: The name of the appliance.

status.description: The status of the appliance. Supported values are: 'ready', 'in-use', and 'unpaired'.

tags.description: The tags of the appliance.

ids.description: The unique ids of the appliances. This is a computed field and is not required to be set.

tags.description: A list of tags to filter the appliances.
